0:
--------------------
Text: The Battles of the Kinarot Valley (Hebrew: הַמַּעֲרָכָה בְּבִקְעַת כִּנָּרוֹת‎ , "HaMa'arakha BeBik'at Kinarot"), is a collective name for a series of military engagements between the Haganah and the Syrian army during the 1948 Arab–Israeli War, fought between May 15–22, 1948 in the Kinarot Valley.
Triplets:<The Battles of the Kinarot Valley
1:
--------------------
<Text: Battles of the Kinarot Valley:  It includes two main sites: the Battle of Degania–Samakh (Tzemah), and battles near Masada–Sha'ar HaGolan.>

Tripelts:<Battles of the Kinarot Valley
2:
--------------------
Text: Battles of the Kinarot Valley:  The engagements were part of the battles of the Jordan Valley, which also saw fighting against Transjordan in the area of Gesher.
Triplets:<Battles of the Kinarot Valley
